page.title: 19CHEDDAR RESERVOIR
page.content: {Cheddar Reservoir}is situated between {Axbridge and Cheddar.}It was built in 1922 by the Council. Some of the water comes from rain but the rest comes down from springs in the Gorge. The water is pumped to treatment works at Cheddar. The water then goes off to places such as{Cheddar, Cross, Brent {Knoll, Burnham-on-Sea, and Highbridge. Raw water is pumped from a well where it is treated and then sent to Weston. Some water goes to{Barrow tanks}where again it is treated and moved away to Bristol. {Cheddar reservoir}holds 6,137,000 litres. People{sail}on the reservoir for pleasure and sometimes people go windsurfing. I like watching them falling off when I walk around the reservoir. You can also go fishing in the reservoir. The{fishermen}often catch pike.
